class_notes: PhD Candidates in Biological and Biomedical Sciences only.
course_description: Intended for PhD candidates in the biological and biomedical sciences. Introduces the most frequently used statistical methods in those fields, including linear regression, ANOVA, logistic regression, and nonparametric methods. Students learn the statistical skills necessary to read scientific articles in their fields, do simple analyses on their own, and be good consumers of expert statistical advice.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 4427, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: T 8:30-9:50a, Instructor: T. Murphy, Status: Closed
